00121 bool ConnectionManager::wait_for_connection(struct sockaddr_in &addr, long maxWaitSecs) {
00122   ConnectionStatePtr connStatePtr;
00123 
00124   {
00125     boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(m_impl->mutex);
00126     SockAddrMapT<ConnectionStatePtr>::iterator iter = m_impl->connMap.find(addr);
00127     if (iter == m_impl->connMap.end())
00128       return false;
00129     connStatePtr = (*iter).second;
00130   }
00131 
00132   {
00133     boost::mutex::scoped_lock connLock(connStatePtr->mutex);
00134     boost::xtime dropTime, now;
00135 
00136     boost::xtime_get(&dropTime, boost::TIME_UTC);
00137     dropTime.sec += maxWaitSecs;
00138 
00139     while (!connStatePtr->connected) {
00140       connStatePtr->cond.timed_wait(connLock, dropTime);
00141       boost::xtime_get(&now, boost::TIME_UTC);
00142       if (xtime_cmp(now, dropTime) >= 0)
00143         return false;
00144     }
00145   }
00146 
00147   return true;
00148 }

00159 void ConnectionManager::send_connect_request(ConnectionState *connState) {
00160   int error;
00161   DispatchHandlerPtr handlerPtr(this);
00162 
00163   if (connState->localAddr.sin_port != 0)
00164     error = m_impl->comm->connect(connState->addr, connState->localAddr, handlerPtr);
00165   else
00166     error = m_impl->comm->connect(connState->addr, handlerPtr);
00167 
00168   if (error == Error::COMM_ALREADY_CONNECTED) {
00169     connState->connected = true;
00170     connState->cond.notify_all();
00171   }
00172   else if (error != Error::OK) {
00173     if (connState->serviceName != "") {
00174       HT_ERRORF("Connection attempt to %s at %s:%d failed - %s.  Will retry again in %d seconds...", 
00175                    connState->serviceName.c_str(), inet_ntoa(connState->addr.sin_addr), ntohs(connState->addr.sin_port),
00176                    Error::get_text(error), connState->timeout);
00177     }
00178     else {
00179       HT_ERRORF("Connection attempt to service at %s:%d failed - %s.  Will retry again in %d seconds...",
00180                    inet_ntoa(connState->addr.sin_addr), ntohs(connState->addr.sin_port),
00181                    Error::get_text(error), connState->timeout);
00182     }
00183 
00184     // reschedule
00185     boost::xtime_get(&connState->nextRetry, boost::TIME_UTC);
00186     int32_t sec_addition;
00187     if (rand() % 2)
00188       sec_addition = connState->timeout + (rand() % 2);
00189     else
00190       sec_addition = connState->timeout - (rand() % 2);
00191     if (sec_addition < 1)
00192       sec_addition = 1;
00193     connState->nextRetry.sec += sec_addition;
00194     connState->nextRetry.nsec = ((int64_t)rand() << 32) | rand();
00195 
00196     // add to retry heap
00197     m_impl->retryQueue.push(connState);
00198     m_impl->retryCond.notify_one();
00199   }
00200 
00201 }

00208 int ConnectionManager::remove(struct sockaddr_in &addr) {
00209   bool doClose = false;
00210   int error = Error::OK;
00211 
00212   {
00213     boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(m_impl->mutex);
00214     SockAddrMapT<ConnectionStatePtr>::iterator iter = m_impl->connMap.find(addr);
00215 
00216     if (iter != m_impl->connMap.end()) {
00217       boost::mutex::scoped_lock connLock((*iter).second->mutex);
00218       if ((*iter).second->connected)
00219         doClose = true;
00220       else
00221         (*iter).second->connected = true;  // will prevent further connection attempts
00222       m_impl->connMap.erase(iter);
00223     }
00224   }
00225 
00226   if (doClose)
00227     error = m_impl->comm->close_socket(addr);
00228

00243 void ConnectionManager::handle(EventPtr &eventPtr) {
00244   boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(m_impl->mutex);
00245   SockAddrMapT<ConnectionStatePtr>::iterator iter = m_impl->connMap.find(eventPtr->addr);
00246 
00247   if (iter != m_impl->connMap.end()) {
00248     boost::mutex::scoped_lock connLock((*iter).second->mutex);
00249     ConnectionState *connState = (*iter).second.get();
00250 
00251     if (eventPtr->type == Event::CONNECTION_ESTABLISHED) {
00252       connState->connected = true;
00253       connState->cond.notify_all();
00254     }
00255     else if (eventPtr->type == Event::ERROR || eventPtr->type == Event::DISCONNECT) {
00256       if (!m_impl->quietMode) {
00257         HT_INFOF("%s; Problem connecting to %s, will retry in %d seconds...",
00258                     eventPtr->toString().c_str(), connState->serviceName.c_str(), connState->timeout);
00259       }
00260       connState->connected = false;
00261       // this logic could proably be smarter.  For example, if the last
00262       // connection attempt was a long time ago, then schedule immediately
00263       // otherwise, if this event is the result of an immediately prior connect
00264       // attempt, then do the following
00265       boost::xtime_get(&connState->nextRetry, boost::TIME_UTC);
00266       connState->nextRetry.sec += connState->timeout;
00267       // add to retry heap
00268       m_impl->retryQueue.push(connState);
00269       m_impl->retryCond.notify_one();
00270     }
00271     
00272     // Chain event to application supplied handler
00273     if (connState->handlerPtr)
00274       connState->handlerPtr->handle(eventPtr);
00275   }
00276   else {
00277     HT_WARNF("Unable to find connection for %s:%d in map.", inet_ntoa(eventPtr->addr.sin_addr), ntohs(eventPtr->addr.sin_port));
00278   }
00279 }
